author: Staff Reporter
text:
Vaccine being administered to a child in Madurai on Sunday.— Photo: R. Ashok

Around three lakh children, aged up to five years, were administered oral polio vaccine as part of the second phase of nationwide Pulse Polio immunisation drive on Sunday.

The officials had targeted 3.08 lakh children with special focus on migrant population, children belonging to families working in brick kilns and construction sites. The district administration had set up booths at 1,600 places across the district, which included 26 mobile booths covering the people on the move in railway stations, bus stands, airport and toll booths in highways. Officials said that 6,811 people were deployed for the initiative.

S. Senthil Kumar, Deputy Director of Health Services in Madurai district, said that 97.2 percent of the targeted children were provided the vaccine on Sunday.

Minister for Cooperation ‘Sellur’ K. Raju and Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao inaugurated the drive at the primary health centre in Tirupparankundram in the morning.
title: 3 lakh children immunised
